resources.string: Empath
Start
… Hello? Is anyone on?
(Keep Waiting)
Yeah, I\'m here.
You! You’re not supposed to be here yet. Just… stay there. The others will be here soon.
Red? Yellow? Where are you??
Chill out, I’m on. I just finished my last character sheet.
He’s already here!
He? You mean she?
Uh, no. I’ve been telling you it’s a he.
That’s a straight-up lie! You’ve said she from the beginning!
We’re not arguing about this. Please? He’s here and we need to start. Yellow, are you here?
Yes.
I was also under the assumption that it was a he.
See?!
But Blue has been calling it a she.
:D
Look, let’s just ask. Are you a boy or a girl?
I\'m a girl
I\'m a boy
I love how you guys never take anything seriously. Makes it super fun whenever I plan things like this.
Suuuuper fun.
Maybe if I specifically tell you to be here at a certain time, then you should be here.
I’m here, geez. I was finishing my last character sheet.
Also, when have I ever not been serious? I’m Mr. Serious. No smile here. Nada.
Whatever, yeah. I just want to go over the plan before he gets here.
Wait, he? You definitely said it was going to be a she.
Uh, no. He.
You’ve been calling her a she this whole time! As in “She won’t know what hit her” and “She’ll be crying herself to sleep after this.” Sound familiar?
Okay, it’s possible that those things were said by me. It doesn’t matter.
I’ve been picturing a she this whole time :( You’re messing with my vibe.
Red, c’mon dude. I need to make sure we’re on the same page with this thing. The plan, not the gender.
What about Yellow? We need to wait for her to get on before we start, right?
She knows what to do. And she’ll be here.
So that whole rant earlier was just directed towards me?
Hi, you two.
Hello
Hi, Yellow. For the record, isn’t our guest going to be a he?
That was my understanding.
But you have been calling it a she. It’s unclear.
HA! I think it’s a she. I’m almost certain.
Personally, I imagined it as a he.
Yeah, yeah, enough about the gender thing. Let’s talk shop. Yellow, are you still good with the Mystic Route?
Blue, should we really be talking about this in front of him?
WHAT?
Yes, he’s been here for a minute or so. Sorry, are you a girl or a boy?
Girl.
Boy.
Let\'s agree to disagree. The game begins... NOW.
Have you ever taken a personality test?
Good, you\'re already lying. That\'s an important part of these tests. Just... keep responding naturally.
Stay calm.

You cut through the grassy field on your way to class. You\'re in a hurry, so when you spot a flash of white paper amidst the green, you\'ve already taken several steps. Come to think of it, you\'re not sure you saw anything at all.
Do you go back and look?
Yes.
No.
I go back and look.
I continue walking to class.
Then you\'re familiar with the format. We\'ll ask you a series of questions. Your answers, your lies, and your false impressions of yourself… they will determine your fate here.
It\'s a little different than some personality tests.
Interesting.
Told you so.

You’re on a camping trip with your family, and after a long day of setting up camp, you climb into the tent to sleep. Unfortunately, the unfamiliar buzz of the crickets outside keeps you from falling asleep. Just as you finally begin to doze off, your younger brother shakes you awake and says he needs to go to the bathroom. It’s only a few feet away, you tell him, but he insists. There are monsters outside, he says.
Do you go with him?
I tell him to go without me.
I get up and go with him.
Right, right.
It\'s easy to just click a button, huh?

It’s the final game of your high school tennis season and your doubles partner is playing like garbage. You’re trying your best to be patient, but her constant mistakes are getting to you. With the game on the line, you step back to serve and… you double fault. It’s over. You’ve lost. Your partner turns and gives you the evil eye.
What do you say to her?
\"You know you lost us the game, right?\"
\"Sorry. I choked.\"

You’re sitting on your porch and drinking lemonade. You watch Ninja, your cat, roll around in the dirt like an adorable fool. Suddenly, the neighbor’s kid sprints up, punts Ninja into the bushes, and runs away, cackling.
Do you run after the kid and punch him?
I run the kid down and punch him.
I don\'t run the kid down.
(What the heck, Blue. That scenario was super lame!)
(It was emotional and action-packed, was it not?)

For weeks you’ve been waiting for a rainy day. This is the last day before summer vacation ends, and it’s sunny outside, once again. It’s the worst. All you want is an epic, stormy, solo day at the beach--the sort of day where you can stand heroically on a cliff as the wind and waves pound at the rocks below. Then again, maybe you shouldn’t be so picky with your weather.
Do you go visit a seaside cliff despite the lack of rain?
I go anyways.
I stay home.
